achieved.

INVESTIGATION:
On 10/27/2021 the special investigation intake was completed and assigned.
On 10/28/2021 the special investigation was initiated on site at Vassar House. An
unannounced visit was made to the facility. Upon arrival, the staff was advised that I
was present for the initiation of a complaint investigation. The chief administrator
was not in the building, however Staff A agreed to meet with this worker.
An interview was held with the Staff A. She identified herself as a case manager and
took me on a tour of the facility. I was able to see both Units two and three that were
being occupied at the time. Some residents and staff were also in the cafeteria for
dinner. Staff A was advised of the allegations of the complaint and confirmed that
the agency was aware of and had discussions regarding the allegations. She further
advised that the youth referenced in the complaint were both housed in Unit 2 at the
2

time of the incident. Youth A remains placed at Vassar House, however Youth B
was recently discharged from the program and retuned home to her parents.
Staff A confirmed that agency staff were not aware of the incident when it first
occurred. She reported that there were “rumors” that were going around regarding
two female residents being involved in a relationship and inappropriate activity. On
10/28/2021 Youth A and Youth B were both asked the rumors/allegation. Youth B
admitted that she was in a “relationship” with Youth A and that she had kissed her
and “fingered her” (inserted her finger in her vagina) while in the unit. Youth A
admitted that she was in a relationship with Youth B and that they had kissed, and
she allowed Youth B to “finger her”. Both youth reported to staff that the activity
occurred while in Unit two on Saturday October 9, 2021. Staff A reported that the
agency had been made aware that two staff were present in the unit with the
residents on that day, however one of them (Staff B) was allowing Youth A to braid
her hair. Staff A was not able to advise if there had been an internal investigation
with the staff or if there had been any disciplinary action. A request was made for
copies of the incident reports and any other relevant documents associated with the
incident.
Youth A was brought to the conference room for an interview. She identified herself
and confirmed that she was a current resident at Vassar House residing in unit two.
Youth A reported that she was involved in a mutual relationship with Youth B. She
reported that on Saturday October 9, 2021, she was in unit two along with other
residents. She stated that she was in the personal row and one of the staff of the
unit was sitting in a chair in front of her and she was braiding the staff’s hair. Youth
A confirmed that another staff person was present but was on the other side of the
unit with other residents. Youth A reported that both her and Youth B stood behind
the staff person that was seated in a chair in front of Youth A. Youth A said that
Youth B first kissed her and then while she continued to braid the hair of the staff
person, Youth B put her hand down her pants and inserted her finger into her
vagina. Youth A reported that the actions were consensual and that the staff was
not maintaining line of sight of them as they were both behind her. Youth A reported
that she was unsure if other residents witnessed the interactions of her and Youth B.
Youth A also confirmed that Youth B was no longer at the facility and indicated that
she has refrained from having any additional contact with Youth B after staff was
aware of the incident. She further added that she was not paid or promised anything
for braiding the staff’s hair. Youth A also shared that she thinks the unit had eleven
residents present and only two staff on the day of the incident.
On 11/02/2021 requested documentation was received via email from Vassar House
Chief Administrator. The documents included copies of incident reports dated
10/26/2021 involving Youth A and Youth B, census list of residents in units A and B
on 10/9/2021, employee counseling form dated 10/26/2021 involving Staff B and
program policy regarding staff to resident ratio.
3

On 11/08/2021 an email was received from chief administrator advising of positive
COVID cases at the agency.
On 11/11/2021 an email was received from the chief administrator advising of
additional positive COVID cases at the agency.
On 11/15/21 and 11/17/21 an email was sent to the chief administrator to coordinate
a Microsoft Teams interview of Staff B due to COVID.
On 11/17/2021 the chief administrator responded and confirmed request for a virtual
interview. A Microsoft Teams invite was sent for 11/19/2021.
On 11/19/2021 an interview was held with Staff B via Microsoft Teams due to
concerns with COVID cases on the campus of Vassar House. Staff B was
introduced by the chief administrator and the interview began. Staff B confirmed her
identity and advised of her current position as an SST (Safety Security Team) Staff
person. She reports having been employed by the agency for almost three years.
Staff B confirmed that she was on staff on 10/9/2021 and was present in Unit 2 when
the alleged incident occurred. She reports that there was a second staff person in
the unit with her and there was a total of ten residents in the unit. She did not recall
then name of the second staff that was present. Staff B acknowledged that she
allowed the residents to braid her hair and confirmed that both Youth A and Youth B
were standing behind her and braiding her hair while in the unit. Staff B reported
that she was not aware that the residents were engaging in any type of inappropriate
behavior behind her. She also acknowledged that she failed to provide proper
supervision of the youth by allowing them to be behind her and out of her line of site.
Staff B further advised that the youth were braiding her hair and behind her for
approximately 30 minutes. As it relates to disciplinary action, Staff B advised that
she received a written reprimand, completed training reminding of responsibilities of
the SST position and will also be attending additional training regarding staff
responsibilities and line of supervision.
On 11/19/2021 a brief interview was held with the chief administrator via Microsoft
Teams. He confirmed the lack of major disciplinary action in the file of the staff prior
to the recent actions. He confirmed current disciplinary plan/actions as a result of
10/09/2021 incident. The chief administrator advised that the agency would be
utilizing the incident as a teaching opportunity for both staff and residents of the
facility.
On 11/19/2021 the chief administrator was advised of the preliminary findings of the
investigation.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program
4

statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: Upon completion of the investigation, sufficient evidence was
found to confirm that agency staff failed to provide adequate
supervision of residents to ensure safety. The staff engaged in
activity that failed to allow “line of sight” supervision to be
maintained. As a result, the agency is found in violation of the
rule.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status. This recommendation is contingent on the facility submitting an
acceptable corrective action plan for the noted violation.
